==German== ===Etymology=== From {{inh|de|gmh|vrītac}}, from {{inh|de|goh|frīatag}} (9th c.), from late {{inh|de|gem-pro|*Frijjōz dagaz||day of Frigg}}, calque of Latin {{m|la|dies Veneris}}. Compare {{cog|nds|Freedag}}, {{cog|nl|vrijdag}}, {{cog|en|Friday}}, {{cog|da|fredag}}. ===Pronunciation=== * {{IPA|de|/ˈfʀaɪ̯taːk/}} {{a|standard}} * {{audio|de|Freitag.ogg|Freitag}} * {{audio|de|De-Freitag.ogg|Audio}} :* {{IPA|de|/ˈfʀaɪ̯tax/}} {{a|northern Germany and parts of central Germany; chiefly colloquial}} :* {{IPA|de|/ˈfʀaɪ̯taːx/}} {{a|parts of central Germany; chiefly colloquial}} ===Noun=== {{de-noun|m|Freitages|gen2=Freitags|Freitage}} # [[Friday]] #: {{syn|de|Rüsttag}} ====Declension==== {{de-decl-noun-m|(e)s|e}} ====Hyponyms==== * {{l|de|Freitag [[der]] [[13.]]}} ====Derived terms==== * {{l|de|Karfreitag}} ===See also=== * {{list:days of the week/de}} ===Further reading=== * {{R:Duden}} [[Category:de:Days of the week]]
